alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 8:03PM MST until August 15 at 1:30AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Graham. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms near the town of Pima in central Graham county have produced between 1 and 2 inches of rainfall, and will result in small stream flooding, especially along Ash Creek in the town of Pima. The public reported on social media that portions of US Highway 70 in Pima may be impassable. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thatcher, Pima and Central. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
